page.title: 19FLORA EGMANTON/LAXTON
page.content: The flora of the area is rich and varied. Egmanton Wood,(now owned by the Forestry Commission),clear felled about fifteen years ago and partly re_planted with soft woods, and Lady Wood are naturally deciduous and contain native species such as ash, small leaved lime and oak. Elm is declining due to Dutch Elm disease. Shrubs include green barked spindle, guelder rose and dogwood. Hedgerows consist largely of hawthornspecies though maple, blackthorn and hazel are often seen. Roadside verges and grassy lanes are bright in Springtime with yellow composites such as cat's ear, occasional cow slips, greater stitchwort and speedwell followed by cow parsley, broad leaved dock and creeping thistle.
